definition: satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
(experienced action marker)
and/moreover/yet/for the time being/to be about to/both (... and...)
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
(experienced action marker)

sentences.english: He lives in a shiftless way.
sentences.chinese: 他过着得过且过的日子。

sentences.english: For the past few decades, we have been able to be wasteful and get by.
sentences.chinese: 在过去的几十年里，我们铺张浪费，得过且过。

sentences.english: The third option is to muddle through, shedding a few duds and tolerating the rest.
sentences.chinese: 第三种选择是得过且过，裁掉几个庸才，容忍其他的。

sentences.english: But all had a sense of fatalism.
sentences.chinese: 但所有人都变成了得过且过的宿命论者。

sentences.english: Sum of grief and sadness, and sometimes equal and just warm.
sentences.chinese: 悲伤和悲伤相加，有时等于得过且过的温暖。

definition: lit. as a monk for today, toll today's bell (idiom)/fig. to do one's job mechanically/to hold a position passively
pinyin: zuo4 yi1 tian1 he2 shang5 zhuang4 yi1 tian1 zhong1

definition: see 做一天和尚撞一天鐘|做一天和尚撞一天钟[zuo4 yi1 tian1 he2 shang5 zhuang4 yi1 tian1 zhong1]
pinyin: dang1 yi1 tian1 he2 shang5 zhuang4 yi1 tian1 zhong1

definition: to take things as they are (idiom)/to leave a situation as it is/to be happy with the status quo
to idle/to waste time
ordinary/mediocre
(idiom) to blame the gods and accuse others
lit. to smash a cracked pot (idiom); crazy despair in the face of a blemish, defect, error or setback
to have high standards but little ability/to be fastidious but incompetent (idiom)
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high
at home wherever one is (idiom); ready to adapt/flexible/to accept circumstances with good will
to have no aspirations (idiom)/unambitious
not paying attention to anything (idiom); to idle time away
muddleheaded
unaccomplished/mediocre/feckless
idle/lazy
to drift with the waves and go with the flow (idiom); to follow the crowd blindly
